me.desht.sensibletoolbox.api

Interface ProcessingMachine

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Chargeable, ChargeableBlock, org.bukkit.inventory.InventoryHolder, STBInventoryHolder, STBMachine
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractIOMachine, AbstractProcessingMachine, BigStorageUnit, Generator, HeatEngine, HyperStorageUnit, Masher, Pump, Sawmill, Smelter

    public interface ProcessingMachine
extends STBMachine
    Represents a machine which processes an item in some way.,

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface me.desht.sensibletoolbox.api.STBMachine

        STBMachine.ChargeDirection

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack getProcessing()
      Get the item that is currently being processed.
      double getProgress()
      Get the ticks remaining until this work cycle is complete, or 0 if the machine is not currently processing anything.

      Get the inventory slot where the progress bar should be displayed.

      Get the material used to display the progress bar.

      Get the inventory slot where the item currently being processed can be displayed.

      Return a string to display as a tooltip on the progress counter icon.

      Set the item to be processed.

    • Method Detail

      • getProgress

        double getProgress()
        Get the ticks remaining until this work cycle is complete, or 0 if the machine is not currently processing anything.
        Returns:
        the ticks remaining

      • getProcessing

        org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack getProcessing()
        Get the item that is currently being processed.
        Returns:
        the item being processed, or null if nothing is being processed

      • setProcessing

        void setProcessing(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item)
        Set the item to be processed.
        Parameters:
        item - the item to be processed, or null to process nothing

      • getProgressCounterSlot

        int getProgressCounterSlot()
        Get the inventory slot where the progress bar should be displayed.
        Returns:
        the slot number, or -1 if no bar should be displayed

      • getProgressItemSlot

        int getProgressItemSlot()
        Get the inventory slot where the item currently being processed can be displayed.
        Returns:
        the slot number, or -1 if no item should be displayed

      • getProgressIcon

        org.bukkit.Material getProgressIcon()
        Get the material used to display the progress bar. This material must have a durability, e.g. a tool or armour item.
        Returns:
        the material used to display the progress bar

      • getProgressMessage

        String getProgressMessage()
        Return a string to display as a tooltip on the progress counter icon.
        Returns:
        a progress message tooltip
